primary_factors: No new snow/ice expected during the 6–8 AM bus window; visibility and winds suggest a routine cold-weather morning (not a whiteout/blizzard setup)
Wind chills appear single-digits to teens (well above the ≤-20°F automatic-closure threshold)
Main closure pathway is residual slick spots/black ice from Sunday’s light wintry mix and refreeze on bridges/secondary roads—more likely to cause caution or a delay than a full closure
News intelligence shows no official Rockford Public Schools closure/delay notice yet and no confirmed neighboring-district closures in accessible sources (weak domino pressure)
Power grid signal is benign: statewide outages very low; no evidence of concentrated Rockford/Kent outages that would force closure
decision_rationale: All specialists converged on a low-but-nonzero closure risk (consensus 12%), and the follow-up checks did not reveal the key triggers that usually push Michigan districts into closing. Meteorology indicates a dry Monday with moderate NNW wind and no accumulating precipitation during decision hours; wind chills are uncomfortable but not near extreme-cold thresholds. Safety/infrastructure concerns center on residual slick spots from Sunday’s light snow/freezing-rain signals and an overnight refreeze, which can create patchy black ice—especially on bridges, shaded stretches, and lower-priority neighborhood/rural roads. However, with ~21 hours between Sunday’s precip tapering and Monday bus time, and with normal plow/salt resources, Rockford can usually operate (possibly with spot-treatment and route checks). News intel did not confirm Rockford or neighboring-district closures from official sources in this environment (and absence of a notice is only a mild ‘open’ signal). Power-grid status shows very limited outages, making a utility-forced closure unlikely. Net: recommend OPEN with monitoring; a 2-hour delay is the main contingency if early-morning route checks find widespread untreated ice on secondary roads.

collaboration.summary: Agents reached consensus after 1 round(s) with 0.0% spread. Average probability: 12%.
